Class Game

java.lang.Object
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.game.Game
public class Game extends Object
A chess game, as defined by the specifications of the Portable Game Notation (PGN) format.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game(String gameId, Round round)
    Constructs a new chess game.

    • getVariations

      public Map<Integer,MoveList> getVariations()
      Returns the variations present in the game. Each variation is defined by a MoveList indexed by an identifier of the move from which it branches out.
      Returns:
      the variations

    • setVariations

      public void setVariations(Map<Integer,MoveList> variations)
      Sets the variations of the game.
      Parameters:
      variations - the variations to set
      See Also:
      • getVariations()

    • getComments

      public Map<Integer,String> getComments()
      Returns the commentary of the game. Each comment is indexed by an identifier of the move it refers to.
      Returns:
      the commentary

      Sets the commentary of the game.
      Parameters:

    • toPgn

      public String toPgn(boolean includeVariations, boolean includeComments) throws MoveConversionException
      Generates the Portable Game Notation (PGN) representation of this game and its data. Variations and comments are included by default.
      Parameters:
      includeVariations - currently ignored: variations are included regardless the values of this flag
      includeComments - currently ignored: comments are included regardless the values of this flag
      Returns:
      the PGN representation of this game
      Throws:
      MoveConversionException - if the move conversion fails

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this chess game.

      The result of toPgn(boolean, boolean) is used to represent this game.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this game
      See Also:
      • toPgn(boolean, boolean)

      public void setMoveText(StringBuilder moveText)
      Sets the moves of the game as a PGN textual representation.
      Parameters:
      moveText - the moves to set

    • loadMoveText

      public void loadMoveText() throws Exception
      Loads an already existing PGN textual representation of moves into this game data structure. The internal status of this instance is updated to reflect the loaded moves.

      It is possible to load a list of moves in their PGN textual representation without setting them in advance in the game invoking loadMoveText(StringBuilder).

      Throws:
      Exception - if it is not possible to load the moves
      See Also:
      • setMoveText(StringBuilder)
      • loadMoveText(StringBuilder)

    • loadMoveText

      public void loadMoveText(StringBuilder moveText) throws Exception
      Loads a PGN textual representation of moves into this game data structure. The internal status of this instance is updated to reflect the loaded moves.
      Parameters:
      moveText - the moves to load
      Throws:
      Exception - if it is not possible to load the moves

    • gotoMove

      public void gotoMove(MoveList moves, int index) throws MoveException
      Navigates the list of moves from the initial position of the game until a given position, defined by the provided index passed in input. In other words, updates the status of the board to reflect the game up to move index (included). The provided list of moves becomes active and the pointer to the current position is updated.
      Parameters:
      moves - the moves to navigate
      index - the index of the move to reach
      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position

    • gotoFirst

      public void gotoFirst(MoveList moves) throws MoveException
      Navigates the list of moves from the initial position of the game to the first move in the list. In other words, updates the status of the board to reflect the game up to the first move.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(moves, 0).

      Parameters:
      moves - the moves to navigate
      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • gotoLast

      public void gotoLast(MoveList moves) throws MoveException
      Navigates the list of moves from the initial position of the game to the last move in the list. In other words, updates the status of the board to reflect the game up to the last move.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(moves, moves.size() - 1).

      Parameters:
      moves - the moves to navigate
      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • gotoNext

      public void gotoNext(MoveList moves) throws MoveException
      Navigates the list of moves to the next one in the position.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(moves, getPosition() + 1).

      Parameters:
      moves - the moves to navigate
      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • gotoPrior

      public void gotoPrior(MoveList moves) throws MoveException
      Navigates the list of moves to the previous one in the position.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(moves, getPosition() - 1).

      Parameters:
      moves - the moves to navigate
      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • gotoFirst

      public void gotoFirst() throws MoveException
      Navigates the current list of moves to the first one.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(getCurrentMoveList(), 0).

      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • gotoLast

      public void gotoLast() throws MoveException
      Navigates the current list of moves to the last one.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(getCurrentMoveList(), getCurrentMoveList().size() - 1).

      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • gotoNext

      public void gotoNext() throws MoveException
      Navigates the current list of moves to the next one in the position.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(getCurrentMoveList(), getPosition() + 1).

      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • gotoPrior

      public void gotoPrior() throws MoveException
      Navigates the current list of moves to the previous one in the position.

      Same as invoking gotoMove(getCurrentMoveList(), getPosition() - 1).

      Throws:
      MoveException - if any error occurs browsing the list of moves, for instance if a move is illegal for the position
      See Also:
      • gotoMove(MoveList, int)

    • isEndOfMoveList

      public boolean isEndOfMoveList()
      Checks if the current move in the position has reached the end of the active list of moves.
      Returns:
      true if the position has reached the last move in the active list of moves, or the latter is empty

    • isStartOfMoveList

      public boolean isStartOfMoveList()
      Checks if the current move in the position points to the fist one in the active list of moves.
      Returns:
      true if the current move is the first one in the active list of moves, or the latter is empty

    • getProperty

      public Map<String,String> getProperty()
      Returns the PGN properties of the game.
      Returns:
      the PGN properties

    • setProperty

      public void setProperty(Map<String,String> property)
      Sets the PGN properties of the game.
      Parameters:
      property - the properties to set
